alert.note: Alert for Municipality of Skagway (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 11 at 10:05PM AKST until January 12 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...VERY COLD TEMPERATURES AND WIND CHILLS THIS WEEK... .The first significant outflow event of the season will continue through tonight. Northerly winds of 20 to 30 mph with gusts of 40 to 50 mph with temperatures dropping to 20 degrees below zero at higher elevations along the Klondike Highway are expected through Friday morning. ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 45 below zero. * WHERE...Klondike Highway near White Pass. * WHEN...Until noon AKST Friday. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Winds will decrease overnight along with temperatures. Lowest wind chills will be along the Klondike Highway near White Pass. Near Skagway lowest wind chills expected to be around 20 below.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
